summary:
The Kingdom of England was a powerful state in Europe from the 10th century until 1707. It was formed when Alfred the Great unified Anglo-Saxon kingdoms. Over time, English kings gained control of Wales and became very powerful. The Norman Conquest in 1066 brought changes, moving the capital to Westminster.

England went through different ruling dynasties, like the Normans, Plantagenets, Tudors, and Stuarts. Each period saw important events, like the English Reformation under Henry VIII and the establishment of the British Empire. In 1707, England united with Scotland to become the Kingdom of Great Britain.
title: Kingdom of England
